content.description: Stand start with two opposing crimps. Pull on to the wall and make a hard move up to the giant horn. From here, figure out a way onto the slab and venture up the highball, trend leftwards. The crux may or may not be the first move. Rehearsing the top on rope would not be a bad idea.
content.location: This problem faces the main trail next to "Black Jack Crack", but is hidden from sight by a handful of smaller boulders.Â

content.description: Easy warm up slab/beginner problem, good holds fun slab movements and beautiful rock. I cleaned this boulder so beginner boulders could have something fun and a little taller to have fun on! (Can also be used to access the Amphitheater.)
content.protection: 1-2 Pads, moves are extremely secure and mantle is easy even for beginners.
content.location: Straight past Black Jack crack if you are coming from the road, The clean slab guarding access to the Zeppelin Amphitheater.

content.description: This is a massive boulder hidden behind the giant Black Jack Boulder. Not very many climbs have been established on the block other than an old school V9. There seems to be potential for a hard double-digit boulder problem found on the immense roof though. This boulder is surrounded by other blocks, so much of its surface isn't climbable. There are lots of caves and corridors in the section where one can escape the summer heat.
